visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise overlay on the main background to reduce banding.

developer_setup.description: Developer working in dark room with multiple screens

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is at least 4.5:1 against background. Use lighter grays (Zinc 300/400) for secondary text, never dark gray on black.

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Dark IDE' theme strictly. Avoid light mode unless explicitly toggled (but default to dark).
Use 'Chivo' for all headings and 'Manrope' for body text. Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all code snippets and the editor.
For the Code Editor, use the Monaco Editor (react-monaco-editor) or a similar high-quality component.
The Dashboard should feel like a 'Mission Control' center. Use dense grids, small fonts for data, and clear hierarchy.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do not use gradients for text unless it is the main H1 on the landing page.
Use the provided image URLs for the respective sections. Do not use placeholders.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for overlays.
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable in marketing sections, but keep it dense in dashboard sections.
